newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Three injured in Sydney building explosion.
newsitem.headline: Three injured in Sydney building explosion.

text.p: Three demolition workers were taken to hospital and nearby buildings were evacuated after an explosion and fire at a building site in central Sydney on Tuesday.
Fire brigade officials initially feared a gas main had been ruptured, but said later the workers had broken an underground fuel storage tank in the building's basement.
Firefighters pumped high-pressure foam into the basement to control the blaze, and said there was no danger of a further explosion.
"It seems to be under control. They are still pumping foam ito the basement," a fire brigade spokesman said.
An ambulance official said the three workers suffered burns to their face and hands, and one suffered airway burns after breathing in hot fumes from the explosion.
